# Disorders
### Retrograde and Anterograde Amnesia. 
- retrograde amnesia = loss of memory prior to brain insult
- anterograde amnesia = loss of ability to formulate new memories after brain damage

---
name: 13-7-3
layout: true

# Disorders
### Retrograde and Anterograde Amnesia - TBI. 
- concussion (mild traumatic brain injury or MTBI)

---
name: 13-7-4
layout: true


# Disorders
### Retrograde and Anterograde Amnesia - TBI. 
- traumatic brain injury (TBI)
- closed head injury, or open injury

---
name: 13-7-5
layout: true

# Disorders
### Anterograde Amnesia - Korsakoff’s Syndrome.
- usually due to alcohol abuse
- thiamine (B1) deficiency
- cortical atrophy
- destruction of mammillary bodies, damage to thalamus

---
name: 13-7-6
layout: true

# Disorders
### Anterograde Amnesia - Korsakoff’s Syndrome.
- denial of impairment
- confabulation

---
name: 13-7-7
layout: true

# Disorders
### Anterograde Amnesia - Patient H.M. 
- born 1926, died 2008
- injured in 1935, intractable epilepsy
- medial temporal lobectomy in 1953
- severe anterograde amnesia, partial retrograde amnesia
- intact procedural memory

---
name: 13-7-8
layout: true

# Disorders
### Anterograde Amnesia - Patient H.M. 
- bilateral surgical procedure removed:
- hippocampal formation
- entorhinal cortex
- most of amygdala
- part of anterolateral temporal cortex

- unimpaired working memory

# Disorders
### Alzheimer’s Disease. 
- most common form of age-associated dementia
- initial signs involve medial temporal lobe function
- distant past memory relatively preserved
- impaired consolidation of new declarative memories
- progressive decline in multiple cognitive domains
- end stage patients are often mute, severely disabled
